title: OrgFensakConfig
description: The configuration for Fensak pertaining to your GitHub Organization.

repos.description: The mapping of repo names (scoped to the org) to the corresponding repository configuration.

^.*$.description: The configuration for a specific repository.

ruleFile.description: The path (relative to the repo root) to the file to use for the rules source.

ruleLang.description: The language that the rules source is written in. If omitted, the language is derived from the source file extension. Note that we will always assume ES6 for js files.

requiredApprovals.description: The number of unique approvals from users with write access that are required to pass the check when the auto-approve rule fails. If omitted, defaults to 1.

requiredApprovalsForTrustedUsers.description: The number of unique approvals from users with write access that are required to pass the check for pull requests opened by trusted users when the auto-approve rule fails. If omitted, defaults to the value set in requiredApprovals.

requiredApprovalsForMachineUsers.description: The number of unique approvals from human users with write access that are required to pass the check for pull requests opened by machine users (GitHub Apps, or any user labeled as a machine user in the machineUsers top level key) when the auto-approve rule fails. If omitted, defaults to the value set in requiredApprovals.

machineUsers.description: A list of user logins that map to machine users in your account. This should not include GitHub Apps, as those are automatically labeled as machine users.
